result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

03:32 PM Defendant Christine Marie Richter in court with Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: February 14, 2022 at 2:30 PM

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Victim 1 or her residence.  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
May go to the premises one time, accompanied by law enforcement, to retrieve personal belongings.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge and Andrew Mutchler appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears in court for defendant and she is eligible for counsel. 
ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct-Domestic and Battery-Elderly. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond. 
BY THE COURT: Court sets bond.
